text: 33 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow, small off white head. Aroma is grassy and soight herbal hoppy.bitter, slight fruity and mild grassy. Dry, bitter and grassy finish.

Aroma: weak citrus notes, yellow melon, pine and resin.
Appearance: clear golden color and white head.
Taste: medium pine bitterness, resin, herbs, sticky, malty backbone, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: interesting beer, sticky, nice long bitterness, only slightly warming alcohol.

Huge thanks to WillemsUrenkel for that one! Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass zippy, nice head. Fine hoppy aroma. Starts strong but not alcoholic, fine hoppy notes, fruity like apricot, mild sourish notes. Bitter background. Notes of lemon. Well balanced finish. Still intense hoppy. Good one!

Bottle. Golden coloured with a beautiful head. Lots of lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, pineapple, lemons and pine. Taste is fruity (pineapple, grapefruit and passion fruit), grassy and bitter with just the right amount of honey sweetness. Long lasting bitter and dry finish. Medium carbonation. Some alcoholic warmth. Creamy mouthfeel. Well balanced. Lovely Eis Double Pale Ale (or whatever).

L:
-pours a slightly hazy golden with a big,frothy,white head
-medium carbonation visible
-visible particle floaties
S:
-lemon,soapy,mango,metallic,oranges, piney,mango,soapy
-low to medium bitterniss for the style
F:
-medium carbonation
-medium body
-alcohol noticeable
O:
Just like the Atlantik Ale, this is too soapy for me.

Bottle. Golden colored and hazy with full fine frothy head. Strong tropical nose, passion fruit, notes of pineapple along with critrus and lemon. Slight sweet beginning and a nice strong but not overwhelming bitterness and good dry finish. Well balanced while dominated by bitterness. Full thick body, medium carbonation and a fuzzy, later, foamy mouthfeel. Flavor is tropical, passion fruit and citrus, some spices and with a malty touch, noticable yeast note and some alcoholic pepper in the end. Quite complex, however harmonic and balanced.

33cl bb10/2017, Maruhn. Q: if an ale is frozen, can it technically be an EisBOCK, aka a lager? Or is it just a DIPA boosted by oldschool cryogenics and dryhopping? - Any case, this is a DIPA/IIPA obtained by re-hopping one of the more democratic DE/US crossover APAs, the Atlantik Ale. - Aroma isnt too intense, rather condensed like canned pineapple juice, vanilla powder, dank citrus pith with a tinge of abv. - Flavour also dried pineapple slices, intensely, almost one-sidedly dry grapefruit pith and lingering, near-scratchy dry pine. A bit of a one-tracker with rougher edges - but nicely executed and tastefully marketed.

330ml bottle via trade with Koelschtrinker. Thank you!
Looks: Clear golden honey colour; Three finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 4 minutes; Beautiful sticky lacing with active carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and fruity Ale malt, with lemon candy, strong citrus, passion fruits, light peaches, faint pineapples, floral, sugar, spices, light resins, biscuits and fresh grass. Refreshing!

Taste: Mid to strong sweet rich Ale malt, with grapefruits, strong citrus peels, yellow fruits, light floral, molasses, spices, resins, strong herbs, thick bread, strong lime, strong bitter hops and fresh grass. Really nice!

Body: Full body. Thick, oozy and very creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Rich Ale matyness in a very thick, almost bready Pils-like background, so creamy its like sipping a citrus pie from glass and I kid you not! Lively citrus hoppiness takes centre stage, with strong lime peels, grapefruits, yellow fruits compliments the fat malt very well. Pretty flowery with strong but nice sweetness. Resin ooze is obvious but not overdone. Spicy bready with strong lime and herbs to round. Very fruity and sunny!

Alcohol: the 8.5% booze taste is well hidden but the Pils maltyness and the fruity herbal hops. No knock on whatsoever. Excellent!

Hoppiness: Lemon candy, citrus, passion fruits, light peaches, faint pineapples, floral, spices, resins and fresh grass in nose. Grapefruits, strong citrus peels, yellow fruits, light floral, spices, strong resins, strong herbs, strong lime and fresh grass in taste; Bitterness is strong for a lasting, high astringent bitter-sweet herbal malty finish.

After Taste: Dry. Limey, oozy and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: Given the Nordik Porter I had last night, I thought this one would be a heavy slab of freeze-distilled IIPA, so I am genuinely surprised that it tastes almost like a German Pils with citrusy hoppiness so lively and sparkling, not-so-demanding ooze, and damn right on sweetness. This is exactly my ideal IIPA, and it was done in the Eisbock fashion so this is amazing. Two thumbs up!

Cold hopped with Lemondrop and Simcoe. Beautiful golden body with a nice white head. Intense aroma of resinous hops and lemon cake. Very hoppy, dry, very bitter, hints of lemongrass and bitter orange peel. The finish is a mix of pineapple, pine and pepper. Interesting.
On tap @ Elphi. Like the normal Atlantic Ale, just stronger. Nice, but I would rather define it as a Double IPA.
Dickes DIPA Flair mit dickem Alkofinish. Tropicsmell & sweety Grasy. Nice!!! ELPHI POWER DRINKING before the big LAMBCHOP BRAINFUCK. 0,2/4 Euro. Fass.

0.33 l bottle from the brewerys web shop, best before December 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, foamy, stable, white head. Sweetish, fruity, grassy, slightly resiny and minimally herbal aroma of passion fruit, lemongrass, pineapple and hints of spruce. Rather sweet, slightly bitter, fruity, herbal-grassy and a little resiny taste of passion fruit, lemon peel, pineapple, lemongrass and a touch of spruce, followed by a medium long, quite dry-bitter, grassy-spicy, slightly resiny and a little herbal, almost peppery finish. Medium to full body, slightly oily and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very interesting, quite intense but also refreshing and surprisingly quaffable.
Sampled @ BKL 2017. Leicht trübes leuchtend goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, grasig, Heu. Geschmack sehr grasig hopfig, Heu, Citrusfrüchte, sehr lecker.
The beer has got ahazy orange-golden colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of hops and bitter oranges. taste of hops, grass, spruce, pine, woods and biscuits. Hoppy-bitter finish.

Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is grassy hops, Gletschereis, some pale malts. Taste is grassy, sweet boozy malt body, a bit Gletschereis. Medium carbonation, silky mouthfeel. Quite good.

0,33 l bottle. Pours to light yellow amber, to cloudy body with dense white head. Aroma has mango, citrus and peaches, with some sweet grassy notes. Palate is medium full. Carbonation is soft , soapy, overall watery. Taste has strong bitter flavour with dry afterkick. Finish comes quickly and lingers on the tongue. It calls itself Eisbock, but basically it is a strond ABV DIPA. The flavors of fruity hops are there as is palate but overall it has medium to monotous character. Still nice easily drikable IPA with 8,5 ABV, yet nothing new.
330ml Flasche. Hellblond, opalisierend mit großer, anhaltender Schaumkrone. Intensives Hopfen- und Citrusaroma. Voller Körper. Herb im Antrunk, dann etwas säuerlich und spritzig.
Pours a hazy yellow color. Aroma and taste is hoppy, light fruits, alcohol, light malty. Full body. Dry finish.

Nice bottle but not all information are on the label, for instance drinktemperature.
Cloudy amber beer with cream-colored head, hopy, hopy, hopy, citrus, tropical fruits, full body, 
(I have 0.33l bottle with best-before 29.10.2017 and batch L3031548)

Butelka 0,33l. Z butelki świetny aromat chmielowy, ananas, mango, żywica. Piana obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, delikatnie mętne. W szkle również chmielowo, troszkę alkoholu. W smaku dość wytrawne, chmielowe, trochę alkoholu. Goryczka do umiarkowanej, nasycenie do umiarkowanego.
